r with whom you have a longstanding relationship.=A0 We have several of the=
se guys on either list.=A0 They should also be able to estimate for you how=
 long the process will take.=A0 Bob Benson, in Hawaii, is also a reliable s=
ource on this.

Hello All,

=
Appologies in advance for the remedial nature of my question(s), since this=
 is old hat to many of you. I have recently acquired a sword that seems wor=
thy and interesting enough to warrant a Japanese polish, a saya/habaki and =
submission for papers. Despite I have seen the details of this process a fe=
w times on this list, I don't remember everything, and I certainly don't kn=
ow the chronology of events and their respective costs (approximate) and th=
e amount of time involved.

Could someone tell me (again) the steps involve=
d in sending a sword to Japan, having it polished, having a new habaki and =
shirasaya made and submitting it for papers? I am particularly sketchy and =
forgetful with regard to the use of agents, how to navigate the blade throu=
gh customs, making sure it gets to who it needs to get to, etc. Also, I hav=
en't a clue as to how much this will all cost, nor how long it takes. Any h=
elp is appreciated. Thank you.

Best Regards,
Gary Gabelhouse
